channel.title: Obama's first 100 days
channel.description: What are your inputs on Obama's first hundred days of presidency?

item.title: Obama's first 100 days
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:49, topic:277644”]I call bullshit that drilling the the gulf, cali, alaska, washington, the dakotas, texas, and arizona would have no effect.

But it would also create tons of jobs but green people would have fire parties and shit protesting them.[/quote]

you have to look at it this way, once you give permission to drill baby drill, what are those american based oil drilling companies going to do with all that profit?

you frequently say companies shouldn’t be taxed because the companies use it to hire more workers (despite unemployment rates going up, companies laying off workers by the bucketload) and yada-yada, they don’t pass the savings on to the customers by lowering prices, why would oil companies do any different?

EDIT: and I don’t have a source on me, but when domestic drilling in the US started to decline rapidly in the 70s, if the amount of oil produced by the US had any significant effect on petrol prices, surely the petrol prices would have gone up correct? less US drilling, higher prices right? what actually happened was the petrol prices went down by a dollar

Read full topic

item.title: Obama's first 100 days
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

Niall:

[quote author=m1lkman link=topic=366557.msg3977466#msg3977466 date=1334837116]It’s incredibly expensive to to open up a factory on US soil. They tax everything more heavily than in other countries.

hi europe would like a word[/quote]

k, European companies outsource as well?

Read full topic

item.title: Obama's first 100 days
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:

It’s incredibly expensive to to open up a factory on US soil. They tax everything more heavily than in other countries.

item.title: Obama's first 100 days
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

Niall:

speaking of free market, the big companies aren’t running overseas because they’re being taxed in america, they’re running overseas because they can get away with subjecting their workers to terrible working conditions forcing some of them to take their own lives(see: foxconn)

Terrible working conditions may be true, but that isn’t the only reason. It’s incredibly expensive to to open up a factory on US soil. They tax everything more heavily than in other countries. Government needs to lighten up on these taxes if we want to see “Made in America” more.

Read full topic

item.title: Obama's first 100 days
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:46, topic:277644”][quote author=Niall link=topic=366557.msg3976944#msg3976944 date=1334766663]

Gas prices are rising… again

and what do you propose the president do to lower that?

hint: the president doesn’t control and can’t control petrol prices
[/quote]
Hint: he can allow drilling within the US to become more common. Him going to other countries for oil after saying he would reduce our dependence on foreign oil is bullshit.[/quote]

it has been shown though, that drilling within the us doesn’t have a significant impact on petrol prices within the us

hell, us production of oil has gone up since 2008 - http://www.eia.gov/dnav/pet/hist/LeafHandler.ashx?n=pet&s=mcrfpus2&f=a

Read full topic

hint: the president doesn’t control and can’t control petrol prices
[/quote]
Hint: he can allow drilling within the US to become more common. Him going to other countries for oil after saying he would reduce our dependence on foreign oil is bullshit.[/quote]
Isn’t that a good thing long term? Saves your natural resources for later? Adds value as demand goes up etc

item.title: Obama's first 100 days
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

m1lkman:

Gas prices are rising… again

and what do you propose the president do to lower that?

hint: the president doesn’t control and can’t control petrol prices

m1lkman:

He said that in his first 6 months of office he would have troops moving out of Iraq and Afghanistan. Lie.

but he did get the troops out of iraq - http://www.reuters.com/article/2011/12/18/us-iraq-withdrawal-idUSTRE7BH03320111218

m1lkman:

Gas prices are high because Exxon and all these other gas companies are raising prices, Obama should fix that, but he doesn’t.

free market baby, deal with it

speaking of free market, the big companies aren’t running overseas because they’re being taxed in america, they’re running overseas because they can get away with subjecting their workers to terrible working conditions forcing some of them to take their own lives(see: foxconn)

you know what would get rid of unemployment 100% though? legalise slavery, it’s simple!

Read full topic

item.title: Obama's first 100 days
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

[quote=“m1lkman, post:42, topic:277644”][quote author=RiiPiiNFtW link=topic=366557.msg3976240#msg3976240 date=1334694217]

Obama achieved more in his first 100 days than Bush did in his 8 years. Whats to compare?

So bad at trolling
[/quote]I’m ProBama. Why would I troll about the truth. Its fact. Look up a list. Bush got us into more national debt by declaring 2 wars in his two terms. Obama is blaimed for putting us into more national debt when the fact is Bush had foreign loans funding our wars which wasn’t effecting the national debt. Once Obama came into office he found where it was coming from and noticed that was a huge no-no and put the funding to the right spot.

Yer, the stimulus package passing congress and then failing was ALL BUSHES FAULT. It’s been four years, what has he accomplished? Gas prices are rising… again, our debt is still outstanding, unemployment is up yet again.

  1. The president doesn’t control the gas prices. Hes not to blaim, its the greedy bastards in the east.
  2. Debt is out standing because Bush put us there.
  3. Unemployment isn’t president’s problem.

OBAMA would fucking look better if he had the fucking idiots in congress actually doing the right thing. They’re all controlled by money. Our congress sells us out. He proposes proposals to congress and the fat, selfish bastards disagree because they will lose money.

Obama in fact has tried to pull our military out of the middle east but to no avail. Why you may ask? There are republicans in congress who have friends that sell military supplies to the US. If they’re pulled out of the middle east, where will they make their money? Its all about money and thats what the Republican party fails to realize.

2 years ago he had control of Congress. What did he do? He spent trillions of dollars. Instead of fighting debt, he decides to spend and ungodly amount of money. He said that in his first 6 months of office he would have troops moving out of Iraq and Afghanistan. Lie.

Gas prices are high because Exxon and all these other gas companies are raising prices, Obama should fix that, but he doesn’t.

If Unemployment isn’t his problem, then who’s is it? The American people? Maybe he should lighten up the taxes to companies so they start building factories here instead of over seas. More factories here, more jobs here, unemployment goes down.[/quote]

He had a proportion of the congress on his side 2 years ago, the overall majority were still republicans and it is still this way today.

Obama proposes something, and the stupid republicans in congress reject it because it effects their money situations.

Same as above. He will propose a bill, republicans will lose money through it and denie it. Simple as that.

Read full topic

  2. Debt is out standing because Bush put us there.

OBAMA would fucking look better if he had the fucking idiots in congress actually doing the right thing. They’re all controlled by money. Our congress sells us out. He proposes proposals to congress and the fat, selfish bastards disagree because they will lose money.

If they’re pulled out of the middle east, where will they make their money? Its all about money and thats what the Republican party fails to realize.[/quote]

2 years ago he had control of Congress. What did he do? He spent trillions of dollars. Instead of fighting debt, he decides to spend and ungodly amount of money. He said that in his first 6 months of office he would have troops moving out of Iraq and Afghanistan. Lie.

Gas prices are high because Exxon and all these other gas companies are raising prices, Obama should fix that, but he doesn’t.

If Unemployment isn’t his problem, then who’s is it? The American people? Maybe he should lighten up the taxes to companies so they start building factories here instead of over seas. More factories here, more jobs here, unemployment goes down.

item.title: Obama's first 100 days
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“RiiPiiNFtW, post:30, topic:277644”][quote author=Frell link=topic=366557.msg3975565#msg3975565 date=1334618131]

Obama achieved more in his first 100 days than Bush did in his 8 years. Whats to compare?

So bad at trolling
[/quote]I’m ProBama. Why would I troll about the truth. Its fact. Look up a list. Bush got us into more national debt by declaring 2 wars in his two terms. Obama is blaimed for putting us into more national debt when the fact is Bush had foreign loans funding our wars which wasn’t effecting the national debt. Once Obama came into office he found where it was coming from and noticed that was a huge no-no and put the funding to the right spot.[/quote]
There were no foreign loans paying for our wars, do you hear yourself? You sound like me 2 years ago. Why would there be? We come out of wars with market profit any way.
Both wars accumulated $1T each in national debt OVER A DECADE. Obama spent $5T in his 4 years, and it would be more if the mass spending in the first 2 years wasn’t stopped by a house power change. Its a common misconception that the big hunk of debt was cause by Bush. Obama and Clinton didn’t cause it either, it was carters policy that pushed banks to give loans to people who would not normally qualify for loans. Clinton extended this act and saw no harm in it because of the internet boom. When the people who took advantage of these policies couldn’t pay the loans the housing market collapsed and banks foreclosed on a shtiton of houses and put them up at resale for under market value which caused the crash of housing prices (aka housing market, go figure).

Im not probush, and im not probama, in fact I hate almost all leaders and candidates in modern America. But I can’t stand when people hate or praise for the wrong reasons.

Read full topic
